Description: Head of limestone statuette of a female devotee.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Part of a small group of archaising Classical Cypriot limestone figures brought to Naukratis (British Museum GR1900,0214.22; Amsterdam, Allard Pierson Museum 7835; Champaign, Spurlock Museum, University of Illinois 1926.02.0032; 1926.02.0029; Cambridge, Fitzwilliam Museum GR.3.1899 Oxford, Ashmolean Museum AN1886.457; AN1896-1908-G.1042; Bristol, City Art Gallery & Museum H446.c). The style is Cypro-Classical, similar and possible from temple boy sculptures dated 475BC-400BC (Beer 1994, cat 297, 299, 294, 25, 35). Beer, C. 1994. ‘Temple-boys: A study of Cypriote votive sculpture’. Studies in Mediterranean Archaeology. Vol. CXIII, Stockholm. Budde, L. and Nicholls, R. 1967. Catalogue of the Greek and Roman sculpture in the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (CD.132) (Phase 3)
